link_desc:
The template was created with a HyperFlex Stretched Cluster based on 3.5(2g) and Zabbix 4.4. It’s using the RestAPI interface of HyperFlex.

If you’re not using a Stretched Cluster, you should disable the ‘Witness’ Items in the Cluster Discovery.

Features:

  • Check of Cluster State (Cluster Status, Resiliency Status, Resiliency Policy Compliance Status)
  • Witness Status
  • Capacity Monitoring (Total, Free and Used Space – Storage Savings)
  • Performance Monitoring (IOPS, Latency, Throughput)
  • Datastore Monitoring (Mount Status, Accessibility Status, Space Usage)
  • Storage Node Monitoring (Cluster State and ICMP Check)

Not Implemented:

  • Check of Hard drives (The API provides the status of the hard drives, but I wasn’t able to query this information because of limitations within the LLD of Zabbix. I would need a (2x) Nested LLD which Zabbix doesn’t support yet).

Macros

When adding a Host, please add/fill out the following Macros, as these are necessary for the checks:

{$HYPERFLEX_HOST} = IP or DNS of the Cluster Management IP
{$HYPERFLEX_USER} = User for connecting to HyperFlex RestAPI (Under 3.5 it's always 'admin')
{$HYPERFLEX_PASSWORD} = Password for Connecting to HyperFlex RestAPI
